column4: Quick question... I've downloaded what has seemed to be 300 different ubuntu iso's. All of them have md5 mismatches on various debs (most often the linux kernel.) -- I've tried two cd burners, and I cannot figure out why the md5 mismatches are happening. Is this a common problem?
I've tried multiple mirrors, and even the dvd iso bittorrent has this problem.
no it is not
well Crackez : I have no clue why this is happening.
what are you downloading with?
firefox.
hmm, i've never had a problem with firefox, what about your network connection, is it flakey?
nope.
I've downloaded debian iso's and such and all of them pass the checks.
the smae thing happened to me once, and it was my nic
it's a nvnet nic.
actually that whole machine died... ah memories
I don't know if that'd be it, though.
well, maybe not, thats just how it was for me
Because I've burnt other iso's of other distrobutions to check... and even recently downloaded iso's passed without md5 mismatches.
do you have a unix machine elsewhere that you could do the download from?
Yes. This one.
let me try that out
perhaps your isp has a flakey router...
it would suck if it's that. I was planning to set up a gigabit network, and I don't want to buy more nics
heh
i wish i had gigabit, i still have a cisco 3640 with only 10mbit interfaces
it routes between my wifi and the rest of my lan
the box I'm on right now is just up for storage / such. Soon it'll become my router, so heh. I'll be doing fine shortly. (-- Stupid d-link router currently.)
